intro: Tephrosia griseola, commonly known as gray leaved tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive grayish-green hue. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, arranged in clustered inflorescences. Tephrosia griseola is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
